news.title: EU-US trade deal: Trump says pharmaceutical deal coming in 'near future’ as France slams trade pact
news.summary: The US struck a framework trade agreement with the European Union on Sunday, imposing a 15pc import tariff on most EU goods - half the threatened rate - and averting a bigger trade war between the two allies that account for almost a third of global trade.

news.title: ‘There was blood all over his head and mouth’ – baby left with head injuries after mum grabbed from behind while pushing pram in park
news.summary: A 20-month-old baby was left with head injuries after an alleged attempted assault on his mother during their daily walk in a south Dublin suburb.

news.summary: I broke my ankle and got to experience the American healthcare system and now I genuinely couldn’t love Beaumont Hospital any more.

news.title: Victorious Kerry footballers bring Sam Maguire to sick kids at Children's Health Ireland in Temple Street
news.summary: Fresh from their impressive All-Ireland victory over Donegal on Sunday, some members of the Kerry senior football team took time out of their celebrations on Monday morning to go and visit young patients and staff at Children’s Health Ireland (CHI) at Temple Street in Dublin.

news.summary: They have ditched the pints for bubble tea, and late-night clubbing for early-morning runs, but while Gen Z-ers have a reputation for being the healthiest generation ever, there are some concerns social isolation is on the rise.

news.title: ‘I found myself standing semi-naked on the roof of a cop car in Amsterdam – but they were nice about it’
news.summary: Donal Ryan is an author from Nenagh, Co Tipperary. He has published several novels, including his most recent work of fiction,  H eart, Be at Peace , for which he won the 2025 Orwell Prize for political fiction. He lives in Co Limerick with his wife and two children.

news.title: Ask Allison: I’m absolutely devastated by the loss of my beloved parents and my husband finds it annoying. Am I abnormal?
news.summary: I recently lost both my parents within two years and I was incredibly close to both of them. I am married and have one teenage son, so I do have other family left, but I am so incredibly bereft that I wonder if it is abnormal. Every time I walk through the door, I break down into tears and can't begin to do what needs to be done.

news.title: Leading Irish horse trainer Edward O’Grady dies aged 75, family announces
news.summary: Edward O’Grady, one of the greats of Irish National Hunt racing, died on Sunday evening at the age of 75, his family has announced.
